title: DuPage County in 60 seconds
full text:
Train for an emergency:
Registration is under way for a nine-week training session for Carol Stream residents interested in becoming part of the village's Community Emergency Response Team. The volunteer group assists first responders by applying basic response and organizational skills to a limited- or large-scale emergency. Training sessions, held from 6 to 9:30 p.m. Thursdays, begin Oct. 4 and continue through Dec. 6 at the fire district's headquarters at 365 N. Kuhn Road. Topics include disaster preparedness, fire safety, medical operations, search and rescue, and terrorism. There is no fee. Contact police officer Thomas Eby at (630) 871-6201 or teby@carolstream.org
Ryder Cup lecture:
As the 2012 Ryder Cup approaches next month at Medinah Country Club, you can discover the history of golf's premier international competition during a lecture by pro Peter Longo at 7:30 p.m. Tuesday, Aug. 28 at Mayslake Peabody Estate, 1717 W. 31st St., Oak Brook. The Ryder Cup began in 1921 as a goodwill exhibition and has grown to one of the most fiercely contested team events. Longo is a trick-shot artist, speaker, historian and television personality. Admission is $3. Guided tours of Mayslake Hall will be available at 6:30 p.m. for $5 a person. For details, call (630) 206-9566.
Honors for Roselle winery:
As part of the Office of the Comptroller's "Agri-Tourism Day" at the Illinois State Fair in Springfield, Comptroller Judy Baar Topinka congratulated Lynfred Winery of Roselle. Founded by Fred Koehler, considered by many to be the father of the Illinois wine industry, Lynfred opened in 1979 and produced more than 5,000 gallons of wine. "Lynfred Winery educates the public and promotes tourism for our state, and I thank the many people who work so hard to make it happen," Topinka said.

Load-Date: August 22, 2012
